creator: gavr145@gmail.com
text:
Hi, I'm getting 100<4==true - when using 2 variables while using of constant on any position - works correctly. I had to change the code (to take one variable from a bean and that works as well - to fix the problem in my code. But this seems to be weird... Tried both jakarta-taglibs-standard-1.1.2.zip and jakarta-taglibs-20060829.zip - behave the same. test.jsp demonstrating the bug: ------8<------ <% long x=4; pageContext.setAttribute("x", Long.toString(x)); long y=100; pageContext.setAttribute("y", Long.toString(y)); %> y=${y},x=${x}, ${y}<${x} is ${y However if we'll change any of variables to a constant - no problem:
y=100,x=${x}, 100<${x} is ${100 y=${y},x=4, ${y}<4 is ${y<4}
y=100,x=4, 100<4 is ${100<4}
------8<------ what I'm getting in the browser: ------8<------ y=100,x=4, 100<4 is true However if we'll change any of variables to a constant - no problem: y=100,x=4, 100<4 is false y=100,x=4, 100<4 is false y=100,x=4, 100<4 is false ------8<------ thanks Vasili

creator: bayard@apache.org
text: Thanks for the report Vasili. I'll get this into the unit tests for 1.2 to see if that confirms and can then start debugging. Presumably the 100<4 is because it's treating it alphabetically.

creator: knst.kolinko@gmail.com
text:
"100"<"4" is, indeed, true

Note, that you use Long.toString() and thus are comparing Strings.
If you replace those calls with Long.valueOf(), you will get all those four "false"s that you are expecting.

Also, you are reporting this to a wrong product. EL expressions an a page are evaluated by JSP engine that is part of the web server that you are using, and not by any Taglib.
